name: And Then She Fell by Alicia Elliott – By the Lake Book Club
description:
Join Alicia Elliott, author of And Then She Fell—a National Bestseller and Indigenous Voices Award winner—for a discussion of her powerful novel. The story follows Alice, a young Mohawk woman whose seemingly perfect life unravels as she confronts inherited trauma, self-doubt, and the challenges of motherhood, exploring themes of Native life, mental health, and identity.

The By the Lake Book Club hosts six Tuesday-night events from February to December, featuring top Canadian authors. Each in-person event includes readings, discussions, Q&A, book signings, and ASL interpretation. Virtual events are subtitled live and provide online viewing and audio.

name: By the Lake Book Club – 3-Event Package
description:
Enjoy the final three By the Lake Book Club events of 2025 for just $55. Join Humber Polytechnic alumni as they dive into conversation with leading Canadian authors. This package features:

•	Alicia Elliott – September 16
•	Anuja Varghese – October 14
•	Maurice Vellekoop – December 9

Each event takes place on Tuesday evening and includes a reading, discussion, audience Q&A, book-signing and American sign language interpretation.
